nodes.name: Sticky Note1

parameters.content:
**Webhook from Line**

















You need to set-up this webhook at Line Manager or Line Developer Console

You'll need to copy Webhook URL from this node to put in Line Console

Also, don't forget to remove 'test' part when going for production

{{ $env.API_BASE_URL }}

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note2

parameters.content:
**Line Loading Animation**

















This node is to only give ... loading animation back in Line.

It seems stupid but it actually tells user that the workflow is running and you are not left waiting without hope

To authorize, you can fill in the Line Token in the node here, or you can you header authorization (shown at the 'reply message' node)

{{ $env.API_BASE_URL }}

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note

parameters.content:
**OpenRouter.ai**

















This is to call LLMs model at Openrouter.ai 

You can use it to call ChatGPT, Lllama, Qwen, Deepseek, and much more with just standardized API call and top-up only once

{{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }}

nodes.name: Workflow Documentation

parameters.content:
# Chinese Translator

## Overview
Automated workflow: Chinese Translator. This workflow integrates 6 different services: webhook, stickyNote, httpRequest, switch, stopAndError. It contains 40 nodes and follows best practices for error handling and security.

## Workflow Details
- **Total Nodes**: 40
- **Node Types**: 6
- **Error Handling**: ✅ Implemented
- **Security**: ✅ Hardened (no sensitive data)
- **Documentation**: ✅ Complete

## Node Breakdown
- **Line Webhook**: webhook
- **Line Loading Animation**: httpRequest
- **Sticky Note1**: stickyNote
- **Sticky Note2**: stickyNote
- **Sticky Note**: stickyNote
- **Sticky Note3**: stickyNote
- **Sticky Note4**: stickyNote
- **Switch**: switch
- **Sticky Note5**: stickyNote
- **Get Image**: httpRequest
- ... and 30 more nodes

## Usage Instructions
1. **Configure Credentials**: Set up all required API keys and credentials
2. **Update Variables**: Replace any placeholder values with actual data
3. **Test Workflow**: Run in test mode to verify functionality
4. **Deploy**: Activate the workflow for production use

## Security Notes
- All sensitive data has been removed or replaced with placeholders
- Error handling is implemented for reliability
- Follow security best practices when configuring credentials

## Troubleshooting
- Check error logs if workflow fails
- Verify all credentials are properly configured
- Ensure all required services are accessible
